Parameter Validations

Using IParseHandlers along with dino.model property provides a clean way of validating request data. By the end of this guide, you will learn some best practises to handle parameter validations.

Using Parameter Validations

1. Create custom IParseHandlers


    

    
    
        
  • It is recommended to set
            model.isValid to false when action parameters fails the validation.
    • 
        
  • While adding values to
            model.values, we have to set the parameter key to differentiate with other action parameters.
    • 
        
  • While adding validation errors to
            model.errors, we have to set the parameter key to differentiate with other action parameters.
    • 
        
  • 
            Always use
            .push for
            model.values and
            model.errors, because assigning values would override the object.
        
    • 
        
  • 
            Do no throw any exceptions while performing validations because it would not pass the control back to controller.
        
    • 
    

    
2. Add IParseHandlers to Controller

    

        

    

    

        From the above example, we have learnt seperation of validation concerns from controllers logic.
        Parameter validations provides an ability to reuse validation handlers with constructive errors displayed
        back to user.
    




DinoModel and its properties



    
DinoModel holds the model-values and model-errors which are added by IParseHandlers. This property is derived from ApiController
        and it is accessible using
        this.model
    

    
List of properties

    
    
        
  • 
            isValid: boolean - placeholder whether model data is valid or not
    • 
        
  • 
            values: KeyValuePair[] - placeholder for action parameter key and value pairs
    • 
        
  • 
            errors: ModelError[] - placeholder for action parameter key and errors pairs
    • 
    





    

        
        Remember
    

    
    
        
  • 
            Do no throw any exceptions while performing validations because it would not pass the control back to controller.
        
    • 
        
  • 
            Always use
            .push for
            model.values and
            model.errors, because assigning values would override the object.
        
    •
